entry.title: X- problem of value three
entry.summary: The X-problem of number 3 for one dimension and related observations are discussed

entry.title: Fibonacci-Like Polynomials Produced by m-ary Huffman Codes for Absolutely Ordered Sequences
entry.summary: Fibonacci-like polynomials produced by m-ary Huffman codes for absolutely ordered sequences have been described.

entry.title: Computing Fibonacci numbers on a Turing Machine
entry.summary: A Turing machine that computes Fibonacci numbers is described.

entry.title: The minimum linear arrangement problem on proper interval graphs
entry.summary: We present a linear time algorithm for the minimum linear arrangement problem on proper interval graphs. The obtained ordering is a 4-approximation for general interval graphs

entry.title: Polynomial Time Symmetry and Isomorphism Testing for Connected Graphs
entry.summary: We use the concept of a Kirchhoff resistor network (alternatively random walk on a network) to probe connected graphs and produce symmetry revealing canonical labelings of the graph(s) nodes and edges.

entry.title: Sudo-Lyndon
entry.summary: Based on Lyndon words, a new Sudoku-like puzzle is presented and some relative theoretical questions are proposed.

entry.title: Set Matrices and The Path/Cycle Problem
entry.summary: Presentation of set matrices and demonstration of their efficiency as a tool using the path/cycle problem.

entry.title: Le probleme de l'isomorphisme de graphes est dans P
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author, due to possible counter-examples.

entry.title: Ferrers Dimension and Boxicity
entry.summary: This note explores the relation between the boxicity of undirected graphs and the Ferrers dimension of digraphs.

entry.title: Seidel complementation on ($P_5$, $House$, $Bull$)-free graphs
entry.summary: We consider the Seidel complementation on ($P_5, \bar{P_5}, Bull)$-free graphs

entry.title: How to generate an object under an ordinary Boltzmann distribution via an exponential Boltzmann sampler
entry.summary: This short note presents an efficient way to derive from an exponential Boltzmann sampler a ordinary Boltzmann sampler

entry.title: Stability number and f-factors in graphs
entry.summary: We present a new sufficient condition on stability number and toughness of the graph to have an f-factor.

entry.title: Multidimensional effective S-adic systems are sofic
entry.summary: In this article we prove that multidimensional effective S-adic systems, obtained by applying an effective sequence of substitutions chosen among a finite set of substitutions, are sofic subshifts.

entry.title: Asymptotic expansions for enumerating connected labelled graphs
entry.summary: I compute several terms of the asymptotic expansion of the number of connected labelled graphs with n nodes and m edges, for small k=m-n.

entry.title: Open Problems in Analysis of Boolean Functions
entry.summary: A list of open problems in the field of analysis of boolean functions, compiled February 2012 for the Simons Symposium.

entry.title: Automorphism groups of graphs
entry.summary: These lecture notes provide an introduction to automorphism groups of graphs. Some special families of graphs are then discussed, especially the families of Cayley graphs generated by transposition sets.

entry.title: A Generalized Markov-Chain Modelling Approach to $(1,λ)$-ES Linear Optimization
entry.summary: The manuscript generalizes several recent results of the 2nd author concerning Markov-Chain Modelling of $(1,\lambda )$-ES Linear Optimization.

entry.title: Linear time Constructions of some $d$-Restriction Problems
entry.summary: We give new linear time globally explicit constructions for perfect hash families, cover-free families and separating hash functions.

entry.title: PDE Approaches to Graph Analysis
entry.summary: This paper surveys and discusses recent work adapting partial differential equation (PDE) models to discrete structures.

entry.title: A complexity dichotomy for the dominating set problem
entry.summary: We completely determine the complexity status of the dominating set problem for hereditary graph classes defined by forbidden induced subgraphs with at most five vertices.

entry.title: 1700 Forests
entry.summary: Since ordered trees and Dyck paths are equinumerous, so are ordered forests and grand-Dyck paths that start with an upwards step.

entry.title: Touchard's Drunkard
entry.summary: Based on Touchard's identity, a simple derivation is given for the enumeration of the N/S/E/W walks that remain on the north side of the origin.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Journal of Integer Sequences, Vol. 20 (2017), Article 17.1.5

entry.title: Compressibility and probabilistic proofs
entry.summary: We consider several examples of probabilistic existence proofs using compressibility arguments, including some results that involve Lov\'asz local lemma.

entry.title: Detecting induced subdivision of $K_4$
entry.summary: In this paper, we propose a polynomial-time algorithm to test whether a given graph contains a subdivision of $K_4$ as an induced subgraph.

entry.title: Extending Partial Representations of Unit Circular-arc Graphs
entry.summary: The partial representation extension problem, introduced by Klav\'{i}k et al. (2011), generalizes the recognition problem. In this short note we show that this problem is NP-complete for unit circular-arc graphs.

entry.title: Homothetic triangle representations of planar graphs
entry.summary: We prove that every planar graph is the intersection graph of homothetic triangles in the plane.

entry.title: Decomposition Lemmas
entry.summary: We define two recursive functions obtained by decomposition of a given interval into four close parts and prove two lemmas which determine features of these functions.

entry.title: Yet Another Proof of the Aperiodicity of Robinson Tiles
entry.summary: Short proof of the aperiodicity of the Robinson tile set.

entry.title: The exact complexity of a Robinson tiling
entry.summary: We find the exact formula for the number of distinct $n \times n$ square patterns which appear in a Robinson tiling made of one infinite order supertile.

entry.title: Combining Random Number Generators using Quasicrystals
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author(s),

entry.title: Statistics and implementation of APRNGs
entry.summary: This paper has been temporarily withdrawn by the author(s),
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been temporarily withdrawn by the author(s)

entry.title: Another Proof of an Extension of a Curious Identity
entry.summary: Based on Jensen formulae and the second kind of Chebyshev polynomials, another proof is presented for an extension of a curious binomial identity due to Z. W. Sun and K. J. Wu.

entry.title: Fibonacci connection between Huffman codes and Wythoff array
entry.summary: Fibonacci connection between non-decreasing sequences of positive integers producing maximum height Huffman trees and the Wythoff array has been proved.

entry.title: Quasiperiodic Sturmian words and morphisms
entry.summary: We characterize all quasiperiodic Sturmian words: a Sturmian word is not quasiperiodic if and only if it is a Lyndon word. Moreover, we study links between Sturmian morphisms and quasiperiodicity.

entry.title: On Hadamard Conjecture
entry.summary: In this note, while giving an overview of the state of art of the well known Hadamard conjecture, which is more than a century old and now it has been established by using the methods given in the two papers by Mohan et al [6,7].

entry.title: Certain t-partite graphs
entry.summary: By making use of the generalized concept of orthogonality in Latin squares, certain t-partite graphs have been constructed and a suggestion for a net work system and some applications have been made.

entry.title: On Orthogonalities in Matrices
entry.summary: In this paper we have discussed different possible orthogonalities in matrices, namely orthogonal, quasi-orthogonal, semi-orthogonal and non-orthogonal matrices including completely positive matrices, while giving some of their constructions besides studying some of their properties.

entry.title: On fractionally linear functions over a finite field
entry.summary: Abstrct: In this note, by considering fractionally linear functions over a finite field and consequently developing an abstract sequence, we study some of its properties.

entry.title: Polynomial-time algorithm for vertex k-colorability of P_5-free graphs
entry.summary: We give the first polynomial-time algorithm for coloring vertices of P_5-free graphs with k colors. This settles an open problem and generalizes several previously known results.

entry.title: k-Colorability of P5-free graphs
entry.summary: A polynomial time algorithm that determines for a fixed integer k whether or not a P5-free graph can be k-colored is presented in this paper. If such a coloring exists, the algorithm will produce a valid k-coloring.

entry.title: Hereditary Discrepancies in Different Numbers of Colors II
entry.summary: We bound the hereditary discrepancy of a hypergraph $\HH$ in two colors in terms of its hereditary discrepancy in $c$ colors. We show that $\herdisc(\HH,2) \le K c \herdisc(\HH,c)$, where $K$ is some absolute constant. This bound is sharp.

entry.title: Another Proof of Wright's Inequalities
entry.summary: We present a short way of proving the inequalities obtained by Wright in [Journal of Graph Theory, 4: 393 - 407 (1980)] concerning the number of connected graphs with $\ell$ edges more than vertices.

entry.title: A new lower bound on the independence number of a graph
entry.summary: For a given connected graph G on n vertices and m edges, we prove that its independence number is at least (2m+n+2-sqrt(sqr(2m+n+2)-16sqr(n)))/8.

entry.title: A note on minimal matching covered graphs
entry.summary: A graph is called matching covered if for its every edge there is a maximum matching containing it. It is shown that minimal matching covered graphs contain a perfect matching.

entry.title: On trees with a maximum proper partial 0-1 coloring containing a maximum matching
entry.summary: I prove that in a tree in which the distance between any two endpoints is even, there is a maximum proper partial 0-1 coloring such that the edges colored by 0 form a maximum matching.

entry.title: A course on Combinatorial Algorithms
entry.summary: The paper presents a course on Combinatorial Algorithms that is based on the drafts of the author that he used while teaching the course in the Department of Informatics and Applied Mathematics of Yerevan State University, Armenia from February 2007 to June 2007.

entry.title: Finding Paths and Cycles in Graphs
entry.summary: A polynomial time algorithm which detects all paths and cycles of all lengths in form of vertex pairs (start, finish).

entry.title: H-Decompositions
entry.summary: We show that for all graphs H of size n, the complete graph $K_{2n+1}$ has an $H$-decomposition.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: An algorithm for solving the Independent Set problem
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author, due an error in claim 1.

entry.title: Convex and linear models of NP-problems
entry.summary: Reducing the NP-problems to the convex/linear analysis on the Birkhoff polytope.
entry.arxiv:comment: In part, the results were presented on WCECS 2007/ICCSA 2007. V2 edited

entry.title: Maximum directed cuts in digraphs with degree restriction
entry.summary: For integers m,k >= 1, we investigate the maximum size of a directed cut in directed graphs in which there are m edges and each vertex has either indegree at most k or outdegree at most k.

entry.title: On Lower Bound for W(K_{2n})
entry.summary: The lower bound W(K_{2n})>=3n-2 is proved for the greatest possible number of colors in an interval edge coloring of the complete graph K_{2n}.

entry.title: Interval Edge Colourings of Complete Graphs and n-cubes
entry.summary: For complete graphs and n-cubes bounds are found for the possible number of colours in an interval edge colourings.

entry.title: Interval Colourings of Some Regular Graphs
entry.summary: A lower bound is obtained for the greatest possible number of colors in an interval colourings of some regular graphs.

entry.title: 5-cycles and the Petersen graph
entry.summary: We show that if G is a connected bridgeless cubic graph whose every 2-factor is comprised of cycles of length five then G is the Petersen graph.

entry.title: On Subgraph Isomorphism
entry.summary: Article explicitly expresses Subgraph Isomorphism by a polynomial size asymmetric linear system.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Polynomial size asymmetric linear model for Subgraph Isomorphism, Proceedings WCECS 2008, ISBN: 978-988-98671-0-2, pp.241-246

entry.title: Binary Morphisms to Ultimately Periodic Words
entry.summary: This paper classifies binary morphisms that map to ultimately periodic words. In particular, if a morphism h maps an infinite non-ultimately periodic word to an ultimately periodic word then it must be true that h(0) commutes with h(1).

entry.title: Finding Large Clique Minors is Hard
entry.summary: We prove that it is NP-complete, given a graph G and a parameter h, to determine whether G contains a complete graph K_h as a minor.

entry.title: The Parikh functions of sparse context-free languages are quasi-polynomials
entry.summary: We prove that the Parikh map of a bounded context-free language is a box spline. Moreover we prove that in this case, such a function is rational.

entry.title: On the length of attractors in boolean networks with an interaction graph by layers
entry.summary: We consider a boolean network whose interaction graph has no circuit of length >1. Under this hypothesis, we establish an upper bound on the length of the attractors of the network which only depends on its interaction graph.

entry.title: Counting number of factorizations of a natural number
entry.summary: In this note we describe a new method of counting the number of unordered factorizations of a natural number by means of a generating function and a recurrence relation arising from it, which improves an earlier result in this direction.

entry.title: Infinite words without palindrome
entry.summary: We show that there exists an uniformly recurrent infinite word whose set of factors is closed under reversal and which has only finitely many palindromic factors.

entry.title: How much does a Hamiltonian cycle weigh?
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate how much Hamiltonian cycles weigh in K_4 and K_5 compare to the total weight of the graph and establish precise estimates.

entry.title: Construction of a Non-2-colorable k-uniform Hypergraph with Few Edges
entry.summary: We show how to construct a non-2-colorable k-uniform hypergraph with (2^(1 + o(1)))^k edges. By the duality of hypergraphs and monotone k-CNF-formulas this gives an unsatisfiable monotone k-CNF with (2^(1 + o(1)))^k clauses

entry.title: A Polynomial Diophantine Generator Function for Integer Residuals
entry.summary: Two Diophantine equation generator function for integer residuals produced by integer division over closed intervals are presented. One each for the closed intervals [1,Floor(n^0.5)] and [Ceiling(n^0.5),n], respectively.

entry.title: Extended gcd of quadratic integers
entry.summary: Computation of the extended gcd of two quadratic integers. The ring of integers considered is principal but could be euclidean or not euclidean ring. This method rely on principal ideal ring and reduction of binary quadratic forms.

entry.title: Coding objects related to Catalan numbers
entry.summary: A coding method using binary sequences is presented for different computation problems related to Catalan numbers. This method proves in a very easy way the equivalence of these problems.

entry.title: On arc-disjoint Hamiltonian cycles in De Bruijn graphs
entry.summary: We give two equivalent formulations of a conjecture [2,4] on the number of arc-disjoint Hamiltonian cycles in De Bruijn graphs.

entry.title: Correction to "Generalized Self-Shrinking Generator"
entry.summary: In this correspondence, it is given a correction to Theorem 4 in Y. Hu, and G. Xiao, "Generalized Self-Shrinking Generator," IEEE Transactions on Information Theory, vol. 50, No. 4, pp. 714-719, April 2004.

entry.title: Notes on higher-dimensional tarai functions
entry.summary: We proved that for every $n\geq 3$, the $n$-dimensional tarai function terminates with call-by-need. It was also shown that the closed form for the function suggested by T. Bailey and J. Cowles is correct.

entry.title: Random road networks: the quadtree model
entry.summary: What does a typical road network look like? Existing generative models tend to focus on one aspect to the exclusion of others. We introduce the general-purpose \emph{quadtree model} and analyze its shortest paths and maximum flow.

entry.title: Multiple source, single sink maximum flow in a planar graph
entry.summary: We give an $O(n^{1.5}\log n)$ time algorithm for finding the maximum flow in a directed planar graph with multiple sources and a single sink. The techniques generalize to a subquadratic time algorithm for bounded genus graphs.

entry.title: Convex Polyhedra Realizing Given Face Areas
entry.summary: Given n >= 4 positive real numbers, we prove in this note that they are the face areas of a convex polyhedron if and only if the largest number is not more than the sum of the others.

entry.title: Hypercontractivity and its applications
entry.summary: Hypercontractive inequalities are a useful tool in dealing with extremal questions in the geometry of high-dimensional discrete and continuous spaces. In this survey we trace a few connections between different manifestations of hypercontractivity, and also present some relatively recent applications of these techniques in computer science.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted for UW Quals in February 2010

entry.title: A note on triangle-free graphs
entry.summary: We show that if $G$ is a simple triangle-free graph with $n\geq 3$ vertices, without a perfect matching, and having a minimum degree at least $\frac{n-1}{2}$, then $G$ is isomorphic either to $C_5$ or to $K_{\frac{n-1}{2},\frac{n+1}{2}}$.

entry.title: Cut locus structures on graphs
entry.summary: Motivated by a fundamental geometrical object, the cut locus, we introduce and study a new combinatorial structure on graphs.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages, 15 figures. First in a series of four articles

entry.title: On scattered subword complexity
entry.summary: Special scattered subwords, in which the gaps are of length from a given set, are defined. The scattered subword complexity, which is the number of such scattered subwords, is computed for rainbow words.

entry.title: 3-List Colouring Permutation Graphs
entry.summary: 3-list colouring is an NP-complete decision problem. It is hard even on planar bipartite graphs. We give a polynomial-time algorithm for solving 3-list colouring on permutation graphs.

entry.title: Obstructions for linear rankwidth at most 1
entry.summary: We provide a characterization of graphs of linear rankwidth at most 1 by minimal excluded vertex-minors.

entry.title: Greedy Set Cover Estimations
entry.summary: More precise estimation of the greedy algorithm complexity for a special case of the set cover problem is given in this paper.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: International Conference on Computer Science and Information Technologies. CSIT2003: 143-144, Yerevan, Armenia 2003

entry.title: Permutation complexity of the fixed points of some uniform binary morphisms
entry.summary: An infinite permutation is a linear order on the set N. We study the properties of infinite permutations generated by fixed points of some uniform binary morphisms, and find the formula for their complexity.

entry.title: On spanning tree congestion of Hamming graphs
entry.summary: We present a tight lower bound for the spanning tree congestion of Hamming graphs.

entry.title: New results on variants of covering codes in Sierpinski graphs
entry.summary: In this paper we study identifying codes, locating-dominating codes, and total-dominating codes in Sierpinski graphs. We compute the minimum size of such codes in Sierpinski graphs.

entry.title: What is the least number of moves needed to solve the k-peg Towers of Hanoi problem?
entry.summary: We prove that the solutions to the k-peg Tower of Hanoi Problem given by Frame and Stewart are minimal.

entry.title: Hardness of conjugacy and factorization of multidimensional subshifts of finite type
entry.summary: We investigate here the hardness of conjugacy and factorization of subshifts of finite type (SFTs) in dimension $d>1$. In particular, we prove that the factorization problem is $\Sigma^0_3$-complete and the conjugacy problem $\Sigma^0_1$-complete in the arithmetical hierarchy.

entry.title: A Low-Depth Monotone Function that is not an Approximate Junta
entry.summary: We provide an example of a monotone Boolean function on the hypercube given by a low depth decision tree that is not well approximated by any k-junta for small k.

entry.title: Some Euler-type formulas for planar graphs
entry.summary: The aim of this paper is to derive on the basis of the Euler's formula several analytical relations which hold for certain classes of planar graphs and which can be useful in algorithmic graph theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: accepted for publication in Int. J. Pure Appl. Math

entry.title: Irregular Bipolar Fuzzy Graphs
entry.summary: In this paper, we define irregular bipolar fuzzy graphs and its various classifications. Size of regular bipolar fuzzy graphs is derived. The relation between highly and neighbourly irregular bipolar fuzzy graphs are established. Some basic theorems related to the stated graphs have also been presented.

entry.title: The freeness problem over matrix semigroups and bounded languages
entry.summary: We study the freeness problem for matrix semigroups. We show that the freeness problem is decidable for upper-triangular $2\times 2$ matrices with rational entries when the products are restricted to certain bounded languages.

entry.title: Claw-free t-perfect graphs can be recognised in polynomial time
entry.summary: A graph is called t-perfect if its stable set polytope is defined by non-negativity, edge and odd-cycle inequalities. We show that it can be decided in polynomial time whether a given claw-free graph is t-perfect.

entry.title: On Generating Permutations Under User-Defined Constraints
entry.summary: In this paper, a method to generate permutations of a string under a set of constraints decided by the user is presented. The required permutations are generated without generating all the permutations.

entry.title: Application of lattice reduction block Korkin-Zolotarev method to MIMO-decoding
entry.summary: This article present a application of Block Korkin---Zolotarev lattice reduction method for Lattice Reduction---Aided decoding under MIMO---channel. We give a upper bound estimate on the lattice reduced by block Korkin---Zolotarev method (BKZ) for different value of the block size and detecting by SIC.

entry.title: 4-coloring $P_6$-free graphs with no induced 5-cycles
entry.summary: We show that the 4-coloring problem can be solved in polynomial time for graphs with no induced 5-cycle $C_5$ and no induced 6-vertex path $P_6$.

entry.title: On the Structure and the Number of Prime Implicants of 2-CNFs
entry.summary: Let $m(n, k)$ be the maximum number of prime implicants that any $k$-CNF on n variables can have. We show that $3^{n/3} \le m(n,2) \le (1+o(1))3^{n/3}$.

entry.title: A necessary and sufficient condition for a graph $G$, which satisfies the equality $μ_{21}(G)=|V(G)|$
entry.summary: A necessary and sufficient condition is found for a graph $G$, which satisfies the equality $\mu_{21}(G)=|V(G)|$.

entry.title: Cubic TSP - a 1.3-approximation
entry.summary: We prove that every simple bridgeless cubic graph with n >= 8 vertices has a travelling salesman tour of length at most 1.3n - 2, which can be constructed in polynomial time.

entry.title: A multidimensional maximum bisection problem
entry.summary: This work introduces a multidimensional generalization of the maximum bisection problem. A mixed integer linear programming formulation is proposed with the proof of its correctness. The numerical tests, made on the randomly generated graphs, indicates that the multidimensional generalization is more difficult to solve than the original problem.

entry.title: Row-constrained effective sets of colourings in the $2$-fold horocyclic tessellations of $\mathbb{H}^2$ are sofic
entry.summary: In this article we prove that, restricted to the row-constrained case, effective sets of colourings in the $2$-fold horocyclic tessellations of the hyperbolic plane $\mathbb{H}^2$ are sofic.

entry.title: Prime Factoring and The Complexity Of
entry.summary: A difference equation based method of determining two factors of a composite is presented. The feasibility of P-complexity is shown. Presentation of material is non-theoretical; intended to be accessible to a broader audience of non academic and theoretical practitioners.

entry.title: Shortest Trajectories and Reversibility in Boolean Automata Networks
entry.summary: The question this research report explores is the following: when does a shortest trajectory between two configurations, or between one configuration and an attractor need to change several times the state of one automaton?

entry.title: F-index and coindex of some derived graphs
entry.summary: In this study, the explicit expressions for F-index and coindex of derived graphs such as a line graph, subdivision graph, vertex-semitotal graph, edge-semitotal graph, total graph and paraline graph (line graph of the subdivision graph) are obtained.

entry.title: Chromatic number of ISK4-free graphs
entry.summary: A graph $G$ is said to be ISK4-free if it does not contain any subdivision of $K_4$ as an induced subgraph. In this paper, we propose new upper bounds for chromatic number of ISK4-free graphs and $\{$ISK4, triangle$\}$-free graphs.

entry.title: ILP formulations for the two-stage stochastic Steiner tree problem
entry.summary: We give an overview of new and existing cut- and flow-based ILP formulations for the two-stage stochastic Steiner tree problem and compare the strength of the LP relaxations.

entry.title: A note on the triangle inequality for the Jaccard distance
entry.summary: Two simple proofs of the triangle inequality for the Jaccard distance in terms of nonnegative, monotone, submodular functions are given and discussed.

entry.title: Second order conservative languages with a Maltsev polymorphism also have a majority polymorphism
entry.summary: The paper proves that for any second order conservative constraint language with a Maltsev polymorphism there is a majority polymorphism. Moreover, the majority polymorphism can be defined by the Maltsev polymorphism.

entry.title: Solving the clique cover problem on (bull, $C_4$)-free graphs
entry.summary: We give an $O(n^4)$ algorithm to find a minimum clique cover of a (bull, $C_4$)-free graph, or equivalently, a minimum colouring of a (bull, $2K_2$)-free graph, where $n$ is the number of vertices of the graphs.

entry.title: The Geodetic Hull Number is Hard for Chordal Graphs
entry.summary: We show the hardness of the geodetic hull number for chordal graphs.

entry.title: Ubergraphs: A Definition of a Recursive Hypergraph Structure
entry.summary: Partly in service of exploring the formal basis for Georgetown University's AvesTerra database structure, we formalize a recursive hypergraph data structure, which we call an ubergraph.

entry.title: Strong immersion is a well-quasi-ordering for semi-complete digraphs
entry.summary: We prove that the strong immersion order is a well-quasi-ordering on the class of semi-complete digraphs, thereby strengthening a result of Chudnovsky and Seymour that this holds for the class of tournaments.

entry.title: Computing the maximum matching width is NP-hard
entry.summary: The maximum matching width is a graph width parameter that is defined on a branch-decomposition over the vertex set of a graph. In this short paper, we prove that the problem of computing the maximum matching width is NP-hard.

entry.title: A Short Note on Undirected Fitch Graphs
entry.summary: The symmetric version of Fitch's xenology relation coincides with class of complete multipartite graph and thus cannot convey any non-trivial phylogenetic information.

entry.title: On Cayley graphs of algebraic structures
entry.summary: We present simple graph-theoretic characterizations of Cayley graphs for left-cancellative monoids, groups, left-quasigroups and quasigroups. We show that these characterizations are effective for the end-regular graphs of finite degree.

entry.title: Preference Cycles in Stable Matchings
entry.summary: Consider the stable matching problem on two sets. We introduce the concept of a preference cycle and show how its natural presence in stable matchings proves a series of classical results in an elementary way.

entry.title: A SAT Encoding for the $n$-Fractions Problem
entry.summary: This note describes a SAT encoding for the $n$-fractions puzzle which is problem 041 of the CSPLib. Using a SAT solver we obtain a solution for two of the six remaining open instances of this problem.

entry.title: Trees in the Real Field
entry.summary: This paper proposes an algebraic view of trees which opens the doors to an alternative computational scheme with respect to classic algorithms. In particular, it is shown that this view is very well-suited for machine learning and computational linguistics.

entry.title: On Cayley graphs of basic algebraic structures
entry.summary: We present simple graph-theoretic characterizations of Cayley graphs for monoids, semigroups and groups. We extend these characterizations to commutative monoids, semilattices, and abelian groups.

entry.title: Warshall's algorithm -- survey and applications
entry.summary: The survey presents the well-known Warshall's algorithm, a generalization and some interesting applications of this.

entry.title: Ollivier Ricci Curvature of Directed Hypergraphs
entry.summary: We develop a definition of Ricci curvature on directed hypergraphs and explore the consequences of that definition. The definition generalizes Ollivier's definition for graphs. It involves a carefully designed optimal transport problem between sets of vertices.

entry.title: Classification of linear codes using canonical augmentation
entry.summary: We propose an algorithm for classification of linear codes over different finite fields based on canonical augmentation. We apply this algorithm to obtain classification results over fields with 2, 3 and 4 elements.

entry.title: A Note on Colourings of Connected $2$-edge Coloured Cubic Graphs
entry.summary: In this short note we show that every connected $2$-edge coloured cubic graph admits an $10$-colouring. This lowers the best known upper bound for the chromatic number of connected $2$-edge coloured cubic graphs.

entry.title: Notes on Monotone Recognition in Multi-Valued Grids
entry.summary: Implementation details of method of monotone recognition, based on partitioning of the grid into the discrete structures isomorphic to binary cubes is presented.

entry.title: Logical-Combinatorial Approaches in Dynamic Recognition Problems
entry.summary: A pattern recognition scenario, where instead of object classification into the classes by the learning set, the algorithm aims to allocate all objects to the same, the so-called normal class, is the research objective.

entry.title: Tight Lower Bound for Average Number of Terms in Optimal Double-base Number System
entry.summary: We show in this note that the average number of terms in the optimal double-base number system is in Omega(n / log n). The lower bound matches the upper bound shown earlier by Dimitrov, Imbert, and Mishra (Math. of Comp. 2008).

entry.title: A Stronger Lower Bound on Parametric Minimum Spanning Trees
entry.summary: We prove that, for an undirected graph with $n$ vertices and $m$ edges, each labeled with a linear function of a parameter $\lambda$, the number of different minimum spanning trees obtained as the parameter varies can be $\Omega(m\log n)$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, 6 figures. To appear at WADS 2021

entry.title: Four proofs of the directed Brooks' Theorem
entry.summary: We give four new proofs of the directed version of Brook's Theorem and an NP-completeness result.

entry.title: Block Korkin-Zolotarev algorithm generalization and their practical implementation (Russian)
entry.summary: We propose a practical algorithm for block Korkin-Zolotarev reduction, a concept introduced by Schnorr, using CPU arbitrary length Householder QR-decomposition for orthogonalization and double precision OpenCL GPU Finke-Post shortest vector enumeration. Empirical tests was used on random lattices in the sense of Goldstein and Mayer.

entry.title: A Solution of Simultaneous Recurrences
entry.summary: The paper is devoted to the methods of solving simultaneous recurrences. Specifically, we discuss transformation of matrix recurrences to regular recurrences and propose a way of solving special matrix recurrences of order three by their decomposition to matrix recurrences of order two.

entry.title: The coloring problem for $\{P_5,\bar{P_5}\}$-free graphs and $\{P_5,K_p-e\}$-free graphs is polynomial
entry.summary: We show that determining the chromatic number of a $\{P_5,\bar{P_5}\}$-free graph or a $\{P_5,K_p-e\}$-free graph can be done in polynomial time

entry.title: On uncertainty inequalities related to subcube partitions and additive energy
entry.summary: The additive energy plays a central role in combinatorial number theory. We show an uncertainty inequality which indicates how the additive energy of support of a Boolean function, its degree and subcube partition are related.

entry.title: A strongly universal cellular automaton on the heptagrid with seven states
entry.summary: In this paper, we prove that there is a strongly universal cellular automaton on the heptagrid with seven states which is rotation invariant. This improves a previous paper of the author where the automaton required ten states.

entry.title: Classification of some cosets of Reed-Muller codes
entry.summary: This note presents a descending method that allows us to classify quotients of Reed-Muller codes of lenghth 128 under the action of the affine general linear group.

entry.title: Permutation Inequalities for Walks in Graphs
entry.summary: Using spectral graph theory, we show how to obtain inequalities for the number of walks in graphs from nonnegative polynomials and present a new family of such inequalities.

entry.title: Drawing non-planar graphs with rotation systems on the Klein bottle
entry.summary: This paper provides a linear time algorithm in the number of edges that, given a simple 3-connected non-planar graph G with a Klein bottle rotation system, outputs a straight line drawing of G with no crossings on the flat Klein bottle.

entry.title: Exploring the Crochemore and Ziv-Lempel factorizations of some automatic sequences with the software Walnut
entry.summary: We explore the Ziv-Lempel and Crochemore factorizations of some classical automatic sequences making an extensive use of the theorem prover Walnut.

entry.title: Morphic Sequences: Complexity and Decidability
entry.summary: In this work we recall Pansiot's result on the complexity of pure morphic sequences and we use the tools developed by Devyatov for morphic sequences to prove the decidability of the complexity class of pure morphic sequences.

entry.title: A convenient trick to compute cluster sizes in a Network
entry.summary: We present a convenient trick for computing the sizes of clusters within a network. The rationale relies on the mathematics of the geometric series and the fundamental matrix of a Markov Chain.

entry.title: Combinatorial Nullstellensatz Techniques
entry.summary: We present different techniques for applying Combinatorial Nullstellensatz to polynomials over finite fields. For examples, we generalize theorems from Noga Alon's paper on the subject, and present a few of our own.

entry.title: Some Thoughts on Graph Similarity
entry.summary: We give an overview of different approaches to measuring the similarity of, or the distance between, two graphs, highlighting connections between these approaches. We also discuss the complexity of computing the distances.

entry.title: Lattice Structure and Convergence of a Game of Cards
entry.summary: This paper is devoted to the study of the dynamics of a discrete system related to some self stabilizing protocol on a ring of processors.

entry.title: Solving Assembly Line Balancing Problems by Combining IP and CP
entry.summary: Assembly line balancing problems consist in partitioning the work necessary to assemble a number of products among different stations of an assembly line. We present a hybrid approach for solving such problems, which combines constraint programming and integer programming.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, Sixth Annual Workshop of the ERCIM Working Group on Constraints, Prague, June 2001

entry.title: Lower Bound on the Chromatic Number by Spectra of Weighted Adjacency Matrices
entry.summary: A lower bound on the chromatic number of a graph is derived by majorization of spectra of weighted adjacency matrices. These matrices are given by Hadamard products of the adjacency matrix and arbitrary Hermitian matrices.

entry.title: Sampling from a couple of positively correlated binomial variables
entry.summary: We know that the marginals in a multinomial distribution are binomial variates exhibiting a negative correlation. But we can construct two linear combinations of such marginals in such a way to obtain a positive correlation. We discuss the restrictions that are to be imposed on the parameters of the given marginals to accomplish such a result. Next we discuss the regression function, showing that it is a linear function but not homoscedastic.

entry.title: Typical random 3-SAT formulae and the satisfiability threshold
entry.summary: We present a new structural (or syntatic) approach for estimating the satisfiability threshold of random 3-SAT formulae. We show its efficiency in obtaining a jump from the previous upper bounds, lowering them to 4.506. The method combines well with other techniques, and also applies to other problems, such as the 3-colourability of random graphs.

entry.title: Generating connected acyclic digraphs uniformly at random
entry.summary: We describe a simple algorithm based on a Markov chain process to generate simply connected acyclic directed graphs over a fixed set of vertices. This algorithm is an extension of a previous one, designed to generate acyclic digraphs, non necessarily connected.

entry.title: Characterisations of Intersection Graphs by Vertex Orderings
entry.summary: Characterisations of interval graphs, comparability graphs, co-comparability graphs, permutation graphs, and split graphs in terms of linear orderings of the vertex set are presented. As an application, it is proved that interval graphs, co-comparability graphs, AT-free graphs, and split graphs have bandwidth bounded by their maximum degree.

entry.title: The Expected Size of the Rule k Dominating Set
entry.summary: Rule k is a localized approximation algorithm that finds a small connected dominating set in a graph. We estimate the expected size of the Rule k dominating set for the model of random unit disk graphs constructed from n random points in an s_n by s_n square region of the plane.

entry.title: Proximity Inversion Functions on the Non-Negative Integers
entry.summary: We consider functions mapping non-negative integers to non-negative real numbers such that a and a+n are mapped to values at least 1/n apart. In this paper we use a novel method to construct such a function. We conjecture that the supremum of the generated function is optimal and pose some unsolved problems.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages, Latex; v2: Introduction expanded, Proof of main theorem rewritten for clarity, formatting changed

entry.title: Coarse and Sharp Thresholds of Boolean Constraint Satisfaction Problems
entry.summary: We study threshold properties of random constraint satisfaction problems under a probabilistic model due to Molloy. We give a sufficient condition for the existence of a sharp threshold that leads (for boolean constraints) to a necessary and sufficient for the existence of a sharp threshold in the case where constraint templates are applied with equal probability, solving thus an open problem of Creignou and Daude.
entry.arxiv:comment: A revised version of this paper will appear in Discrete Applied Mathematics

entry.title: DNA Codes that Avoid Secondary Structures
entry.summary: In this paper, we consider the problem of designing DNA sequences (codewords) for DNA storage systems and DNA computing that are unlikely to fold back onto themselves to form undesirable secondary structures. The paper addresses both the issue of enumerating the sequences with such properties and the problem of practical code construction.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in Proc. 2005 IEEE International Symposium on Information Theory, Adelaide, Australia, Sept. 4-9, 2005; 5 pages

entry.title: Distance-2 Edge Coloring is NP-Complete
entry.summary: We prove that it is NP-complete to determine whether there exists a distance-2 edge coloring (strong edge coloring) with 5 colors of a bipartite 2-inductive graph with girth 6 and maximum degree 3.

author.name: Jeff Erickson
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Computer Science, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, Urbana, IL, USA

author.name: Shripad Thite
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Computer Science, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, Urbana, IL, USA

author.name: David P. Bunde
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Computer Science, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, Urbana, IL, USA

entry.title: Random Walks with Anti-Correlated Steps
entry.summary: We conjecture the expected value of random walks with anti-correlated steps to be exactly 1. We support this conjecture with 2 plausibility arguments and experimental data. The experimental analysis includes the computation of the expected values of random walks for steps up to 22. The result shows the expected value asymptotically converging to 1.

entry.title: Existence of finite test-sets for k-power-freeness of uniform morphisms
entry.summary: A challenging problem is to find an algorithm to decide whether a morphism is k-power-free. We provide such an algorithm when k >= 3 for uniform morphisms showing that in such a case, contrarily to the general case, there exist finite test-sets for k-power-freeness.

entry.title: The neighbor-scattering number can be computed in polynomial time for interval graphs
entry.summary: Neighbor-scattering number is a useful measure for graph vulnerability. For some special kinds of graphs, explicit formulas are given for this number. However, for general graphs it is shown that to compute this number is NP-complete. In this paper, we prove that for interval graphs this number can be computed in polynomial time.

entry.title: Minimizing Symmetric Set Functions Faster
entry.summary: We describe a combinatorial algorithm which, given a monotone and consistent symmetric set function d on a finite set V in the sense of Rizzi, constructs a non trivial set S minimizing d(S,V-S). This includes the possibility for the minimization of symmetric submodular functions. The presented algorithm requires at most as much time as the one described by Rizzi, but depending on the function d, it may allow several improvements.

entry.title: On Covering a Graph Optimally with Induced Subgraphs
entry.summary: We consider the problem of covering a graph with a given number of induced subgraphs so that the maximum number of vertices in each subgraph is minimized. We prove NP-completeness of the problem, prove lower bounds, and give approximation algorithms for certain graph classes.

entry.title: Complexity and Applications of Edge-Induced Vertex-Cuts
entry.summary: Motivated by hypergraph decomposition algorithms, we introduce the notion of edge-induced vertex-cuts and compare it with the well-known notions of edge-cuts and vertex-cuts. We investigate the complexity of computing minimum edge-induced vertex-cuts and demonstrate the usefulness of our notion by applications in network reliability and constraint satisfaction.

entry.title: A Polynomial Time Algorithm for The Traveling Salesman Problem
entry.summary: The ATSP polytope can be expressed by asymmetric polynomial size linear program.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Complementary to Yannakakis' Theorem, 22nd MCCCC, University of Nevada, Las Vegas, 2008, p.8

entry.title: Generalizations of the Hanoi Towers Problem
entry.summary: Our theme bases on the classical Hanoi Towers Problem. In this paper we will define a new problem, permitting some positions, that were not legal in the classical problem. Our goal is to find an optimal (shortest possible) sequence of discs' moves. Besides that, we will research all versions of 3-pegs classical problem with some special constraints, when some types of moves are disallowed.

entry.title: A local balance property of episturmian words
entry.summary: We prove that episturmian words and Arnoux-Rauzy sequences can be characterized using a local balance property. We also give a new characterization of epistandard words and show that the set of finite words that are not factors of an episturmian word is not context-free.

entry.title: Ulam's Conjecture is True for Connected Graphs
entry.summary: This submission has been withdrawn at the request of the author.

entry.title: Constructing a maximum utility slate of on-line advertisements
entry.summary: We present an algorithm for constructing an optimal slate of sponsored search advertisements which respects the ordering that is the outcome of a generalized second price auction, but which must also accommodate complicating factors such as overall budget constraints. The algorithm is easily fast enough to use on the fly for typical problem sizes, or as a subroutine in an overall optimization.

entry.title: Bid Optimization for Internet Graphical Ad Auction Systems via Special Ordered Sets
entry.summary: This paper describes an optimization model for setting bid levels for certain types of advertisements on web pages. This model is non-convex, but we are able to obtain optimal or near-optimal solutions rapidly using branch and cut open-source software. The financial benefits obtained using the prototype system have been substantial.

entry.title: On complexity of special maximum matchings constructing
entry.summary: For bipartite graphs the NP-completeness is proved for the problem of existence of maximum matching which removal leads to a graph with given lower(upper)bound for the cardinality of its maximum matching.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 8 figures. Discrete Mathematics, to appear

entry.title: Two polynomial algorithms for special maximum matching constructing in trees
entry.summary: For an arbitrary tree we investigate the problems of constructing a maximum matching which minimizes or maximizes the cardinality of a maximum matching of the graph obtained from original one by its removal and present corresponding polynomial algorithms.
entry.arxiv:comment: 55 pages, 38 figures, Submitted to Discrete Applied Mathematics

entry.title: On Edge-Disjoint Pairs Of Matchings
entry.summary: For a graph G, consider the pairs of edge-disjoint matchings whose union consists of as many edges as possible. Let H be the largest matching among such pairs. Let M be a maximum matching of G. We show that 5/4 is a tight upper bound for |M|/|H|.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 2 figures, Submitted to Discrete Mathematics

entry.title: Recursive Structure and Bandwidth of Hales-Numbered Hypercube
entry.summary: The Hales numbered $n$-dimensional hypercube and the corresponding adjacency matrix exhibit interesting recursive structures in $n$. These structures lead to a very simple proof of the well-known bandwidth formula for hypercube, whose proof was thought to be surprisingly difficult. A related problem called hypercube antibandwidth, for which Harper proposed an algorithm, is also reexamined in the light of the above recursive structures, and a close form solution is found.

entry.title: Two representation theorems of three-valued structures by means of binary relations
entry.summary: The results here presented are a continuation of the algebraic research line which attempts to find properties of multiple-valued systems based on a poset of two agents. The aim of this paper is to exhibit two relationships between some three-valued structures and binary relations. The established connections are so narrow that two representation theorems are obtained.

entry.title: Approche polyedrale pour le probleme du separateur (VSP)
entry.summary: In an undirected connected graph G=(V,E), the vertex separator problem (VSP) asks for a partition of V into nonempty subsets A, B, C such that |C| is minimized such that there is no edge between A and B, and sizes of A and B are similar. This paper presents a polyhedral approach of the (VSP), introducing new efficient valid inequalities and providing computational tests and results.

entry.title: On b-perfect chordal graphs
entry.summary: The b-chromatic number of a graph G is the largest integer k such that G has a coloring of the vertices in k color classes such that every color class contains a vertex that has a neighbour in all other color classes. We characterize the class of chordal graphs for which the b-chromatic number is equal to the chromatic number for every induced subgraph.

entry.title: Finding the growth rate of a regular language in polynomial time
entry.summary: We give an O(n^3+n^2 t) time algorithm to determine whether an NFA with n states and t transitions accepts a language of polynomial or exponential growth. We also show that given a DFA accepting a language of polynomial growth, we can determine the order of polynomial growth in quadratic time.

entry.title: Direct definition of a ternary infinite square-free sequence
entry.summary: We propose a new ternary infinite (even full-infinite) square-free sequence. The sequence is defined both by an iterative method and by a direct definition. Both definitions are analogous to those of the Thue-Morse sequence. The direct definition is given by a deterministic finite automaton with output. In short, the sequence is automatic.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, 1 figures, to appear in Information Processing Letters

entry.title: On Interval Colorings of Complete k-partite Graphs K_{n}^{k}
entry.summary: Problems of existence, construction and estimation of parameters of interval colorings of complete k-partite graphs K_{n}^{k} are investigated.

entry.title: $m$-Sequences of Different Lengths with Four-Valued Cross Correlation
entry.summary: {\bf Abstract.} Considered is the distribution of the cross correlation between $m$-sequences of length $2^m-1$, where $m$ is even, and $m$-sequences of shorter length $2^{m/2}-1$. The infinite family of pairs of $m$-sequences with four-valued cross correlation is constructed and the complete correlation distribution of this family is determined.

entry.title: The Choquet integral for the aggregation of interval scales in multicriteria decision making
entry.summary: This paper addresses the question of which models fit with information concerning the preferences of the decision maker over each attribute, and his preferences about aggregation of criteria (interacting criteria). We show that the conditions induced by these information plus some intuitive conditions lead to a unique possible aggregation operator: the Choquet integral.

entry.title: p-Symmetric fuzzy measures
entry.summary: In this paper we propose a generalization of the concept of symmetric fuzzy measure based in a decomposition of the universal set in what we have called subsets of indifference. Some properties of these measures are studied, as well as their Choquet integral. Finally, a degree of interaction between the subsets of indifference is defined.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: International Journal of Uncertainty Fuzziness and Knowledge-Based Systems (2002) 105-123

entry.title: An NP-hardness Result on the Monoid Frobenius Problem
entry.summary: The following problem is NP-hard: given a regular expression $E$, decide if $E^*$ is not co-finite.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, working paper; an error in Problem 5 is corrected

entry.title: On the Probability of the Existence of Fixed-Size Components in Random Geometric Graphs
entry.summary: In this work we give precise asymptotic expressions on the probability of the existence of fixed-size components at the threshold of connectivity for random geometric graphs.

entry.title: Pseudo-random Sequences Generated by Cellular Automata
entry.summary: Generation of pseudo random sequences by cellular automata, as well as by hybrid cellular automata is surveyed. An application to the fast evaluation and FPGA implementation of some classes of boolean functions is sketched out.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: International Conference on Relations, Orders and Graphs: Interactions with Computer Science, Mahdia : Tunisie (2008)

entry.title: Essential arity gap of Boolean functions
entry.summary: We investigate the Boolean functions with essential arity gap 2. We use Full Conjunctive Normal Forms instead of Zhegalkin's polynomials, which allow us to simplify the proofs and to obtain several combinatorial results, concerning the Boolean functions with a given arity gap.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, J. of Computing, Serdika, IMI, BAS, Sofia

entry.title: On Fan Raspaud Conjecture
entry.summary: A conjecture of Fan and Raspaud [3] asserts that every bridgeless cubic graph con-tains three perfect matchings with empty intersection. Kaiser and Raspaud [6] sug-gested a possible approach to this problem based on the concept of a balanced join in an embedded graph. We give here some new results concerning this conjecture and prove that a minimum counterexample must have at least 32 vertices.

entry.title: On normal odd partitions in cubic graphs
entry.summary: A normal partition of the edges of a cubic graph is a partition into trails (no repeated edge) such that each vertex is the end vertex of exactly one trail of the partition. We investigate this notion and give some results and problems.

entry.title: Mácajová and Škoviera Conjecture on Cubic Graphs
entry.summary: A conjecture of M\'a\u{c}ajov\'a and \u{S}koviera asserts that every bridgeless cubic graph has two perfect matchings whose intersection does not contain any odd edge cut. We prove this conjecture for graphs with few vertices and we give a stronger result for traceable graphs.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Discussionnes Mathematicae on Graph Theory 30, 2 (2010) xxx-yyy

entry.title: The meaning of concurrent programs
entry.summary: The semantics of assignment and mutual exclusion in concurrent and multi-core/multi-processor systems is presented with attention to low level architectural features in an attempt to make the presentation realistic. Recursive functions on event sequences are used to define state dependent functions and variables in ordinary (non-formal-method) algebra.
entry.arxiv:comment: Technical report on using recursive functions for the low level semantics of concurrent systems

entry.title: Unsatisfiable (k,(4*2^k/k))-CNF formulas
entry.summary: A boolean formula in a conjuctive normal form is called a (k,s)-formula if every clause contains exactly k variables and every variable occurs in at most s clauses. We prove the existence of a (k, 4 * (2^k/k))-CNF formula which is unsatisfiable.

entry.title: Characterizations of probe interval graphs
entry.summary: In this paper we obtain several characterizations of the adjacency matrix of a probe interval graph. In course of this study we describe an easy method of obtaining interval representation of an interval bipartite graph from its adjacency matrix. Finally, we note that if we add a loop at every probe vertex of a probe interval graph, then the Ferrers dimension of the corresponding symmetric bipartite graph is at most 3.

entry.title: Tree-width of hypergraphs and surface duality
entry.summary: In Graph Minor III, Robertson and Seymour conjecture that the tree-width of a planar graph and that of its dual differ by at most one. We prove that given a hypergraph H on a surface of Euler genus k, the tree-width of H^* is at most the maximum of tw(H) + 1 + k and the maximum size of a hyperedge of H^*.

entry.title: On Some Classes of Functions and Hypercubes
entry.summary: In this paper, some classes of discrete functions of $k$-valued logic are considered, that depend on sets of their variables in a particular way. Obtained results allow to "construct" these functions and to present them in their tabular, analytical or matrix form, that is, as hypercubes, and in particular Latin hypercubes. Results connected with identifying of variables of some classes of functions are obtained.

entry.title: The Road Coloring for Mapping on k States(withdrawn)
entry.summary: Let $\Gamma$ be directed strongly connected finite graph of uniform outdegree (constant outdegree of any vertex) and let some coloring of edges of $\Gamma$ turn the graph into deterministic complete automaton. Let the word $s$ be a word in the alphabet of colors (considered also as letters) on the edges of $\Gamma$ and let $\Gamma s$ be a mapping of vertices $\Gamma$.

entry.title: On a problem of Frobenius in three numbers
entry.summary: For three positive integers ai, aj, ak pairwise coprime, we present an algorithm that find the least multiple of ai that is a positive linear combination of aj, ak. The average running time of this algorithm is O(1). Using this algorithm and the chinese remainder theorem leads to a direct computation of the Frobenius number f(a1, a2, a3).

entry.title: A Note on Contractible Edges in Chordal Graphs
entry.summary: Contraction of an edge merges its end points into a new vertex which is adjacent to each neighbor of the end points of the edge. An edge in a $k$-connected graph is {\em contractible} if its contraction does not result in a graph of lower connectivity. We characterize contractible edges in chordal graphs using properties of tree decompositions with respect to minimal vertex separators.

entry.title: Non Linear System for a Veritable PID Substitute
entry.summary: The paper deals with a non-linear system largely used in biology, which, in certain conditions and for particular coefficient values, becomes linear, with a linear diagram over a large range of time. It can be used as a veritable regulator in systems' control
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, exposed on 2nd "European Conference on Computer Sience and Applications" - XA2008, Timisoara, Romania
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Ann. Univ. Tibiscus Comp. Sci. Series 6 (2008), 21-24

entry.title: Hospital Acquired Infections: Advantages of a Computerized Surveillance
entry.summary: To asses the advantages of a computerized surveillance system to detect Healthcare-Associated Infections (HAI). All HAI reported to the Timis County branch of the Romanian National Health Insurance and the Public Health Authority during the year 2007 were collected and assessed for validity
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, exposed on 2nd "European Conference on Computer Science & Applications" - XA2008, Timisoara, Romania
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Ann. Univ. Tibiscus, Comp. Sci. Series 6 (2008), 135-144

entry.title: On Hadwiger's Number of a graph with partial information
entry.summary: We investigate the possibility of proving upper bounds on Hadwiger's number of a graph with partial information, mirroring several known upper bounds for the chromatic number. For each such bound we determine whether the corresponding bound for Hadwiger's number holds. Our results suggest that the ``locality'' of an inequality accounts for the existence of such an extension.

entry.title: Non linear system become linear system
entry.summary: The present paper refers to the theory and the practice of the systems regarding non-linear systems and their applications. We aimed the integration of these systems to elaborate their response as well as to highlight some outstanding features.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, exposed on 4th International Conferences "Actualities and Perspectives on Hardware and Software" - APHS2007, Timisoara, Romania
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Ann. Univ. Tibiscus Comp. Sci. Series V (2007), 55-62

entry.title: Sums of powers via integration
entry.summary: Sum of powers 1^p+...+n^p, with n and p being natural numbers and n>=1, can be expressed as a polynomial function of n of degree p+1. Such representations are often called Faulhaber formulae. A simple recursive algorithm for computing coefficients of Faulhaber formulae is presented. The correctness of the algorithm is proved by giving a recurrence relation on Faulhaber formulae.

entry.title: Sequences close to periodic
entry.summary: The paper is a survey of notions and results related to classical and new generalizations of the notion of a periodic sequence. The topics related to almost periodicity in combinatorics on words, symbolic dynamics, expressibility in logical theories, algorithmic computability, Kolmogorov complexity, number theory, are discussed.

entry.title: Closure Under Minors of Undirected Entanglement
entry.summary: Entanglement is a digraph complexity measure that origins in fixed-point theory. Its purpose is to count the nested depth of cycles in digraphs. In this paper we prove that the class of undirected graphs of entanglement at most $k$, for arbitrary fixed $k \in \mathbb{N}$, is closed under taking minors. Our proof relies on the game theoretic characterization of entanglement in terms of Robber and Cops games.

entry.title: On polynomial growth functions of D0L-systems
entry.summary: The aim of this paper is to prove that every polynomial function that maps the natural integers to the positive integers is the growth function of some D0L-system.

entry.title: All that Glisters is not Galled
entry.summary: Galled trees, evolutionary networks with isolated reticulation cycles, have appeared under several slightly different definitions in the literature. In this paper we establish the actual relationships between the main four such alternative definitions: namely, the original galled trees, level-1 networks, nested networks with nesting depth 1, and evolutionary networks with arc-disjoint reticulation cycles.

entry.title: Subshifts, Languages and Logic
entry.summary: We study the Monadic Second Order (MSO) Hierarchy over infinite pictures, that is tilings. We give a characterization of existential MSO in terms of tilings and projections of tilings. Conversely, we characterise logic fragments corresponding to various classes of infinite pictures (subshifts of finite type, so?c subshifts).
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: 13th International Conference on Developments in Language Theory, Stuttgart : Allemagne (2009)

entry.title: Computing the tree number of a cut-outerplanar graph
entry.summary: While the notion of arboricity of a graph is well-known in graph theory, very few results are dedicated to the minimal number of trees covering the edges of a graph, called the tree number of a graph.
entry.arxiv:comment: These results are not incorrect but are covered in other works

entry.title: A Partial Order on Bipartite Graphs with n Vertices
entry.summary: The paper examines a partial order on bipartite graphs (X1, X2, E) with n vertices, X1UX2={1,2,...,n}. This partial order is a natural partial order of subobjects of an object in a triangular category with bipartite graphs as morphisms.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages,exposed on 5th International Conference "Actualities and Perspectives on Hardware and Software" - APHS2009, Timisoara, Romania
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Ann. Univ. Tibiscus Comp. Sci. Series VII(2009),315-324

entry.title: On maximal repetitions of arbitrary exponent
entry.summary: The first two authors have shown [KK99,KK00] that the sum the exponent (and thus the number) of maximal repetitions of exponent at least 2 (also called runs) is linear in the length of the word. The exponent 2 in the definition of a run may seem arbitrary. In this paper, we consider maximal repetitions of exponent strictly greater than 1.

entry.title: A certifying algorithm for 3-colorability of P5-free graphs
entry.summary: We provide a certifying algorithm for the problem of deciding whether a P5- free graph is 3-colorable by showing there are exactly six finite graphs that are P5-free and not 3-colorable and minimal with respect to this property.

entry.title: Periodicity in tilings
entry.summary: Tilings and tiling systems are an abstract concept that arise both as a computational model and as a dynamical system. In this paper, we characterize the sets of periods that a tiling system can produce. We prove that up to a slight recoding, they correspond exactly to languages in the complexity classes $\nspace{n}$ and $\cne$.

entry.title: Regular Matroids with Graphic Cocircuits
entry.summary: We introduce the notion of graphic cocircuits and show that a large class of regular matroids with graphic cocircuits belongs to the class of signed-graphic matroids. Moreover, we provide an algorithm which determines whether a cographic matroid with graphic cocircuits is signed-graphic or not.

entry.title: Wiener index of binomial trees and Fibonacci trees
entry.summary: We obtain a closed-form expression for the Wiener index of binomial trees. We outline efficient algorithms for computing the Wiener indices of Fibonacci and binary Fibonacci trees.
entry.arxiv:comment: Accepted for publication in Int'l. J. Math. Engg. with Comp., Sept. 2009

entry.title: Boltzmann Samplers for Colored Combinatorial Objects
entry.summary: In this paper, we give a general framework for the Boltzmann generation of colored objects belonging to combinatorial constructible classes. We propose an intuitive notion called profiled objects which allows the sampling of size-colored objects (and also of k-colored objects) although the corresponding class cannot be described by an analytic ordinary generating function.

entry.title: Optimal Partial Tiling of Manhattan Polyominoes
entry.summary: Finding an efficient optimal partial tiling algorithm is still an open problem. We have worked on a special case, the tiling of Manhattan polyominoes with dominoes, for which we give an algorithm linear in the number of columns. Some techniques are borrowed from traditional graph optimisation problems.

entry.title: On the Minimum Size of a Contraction-Universal Tree
entry.summary: A tree T_uni is m-universal for the class of trees if for every tree T of size m, T can be obtained from T_uni by successive contractions of edges. We prove that a m-universal tree for the class of trees has at least mln(m) + (gamma-1)m + O(1) edges where is the Euler's constant and we build such a tree with less than mc edges for a fixed constant c = 1.984...

entry.title: Shortest Paths in Planar Graphs with Real Lengths in $O(n\log^2n/\log\log n)$ Time
entry.summary: Given an $n$-vertex planar directed graph with real edge lengths and with no negative cycles, we show how to compute single-source shortest path distances in the graph in $O(n\log^2n/\log\log n)$ time with O(n) space. This is an improvement of a recent time bound of $O(n\log^2n)$ by Klein et al.

entry.title: Good characterization for path packing in a subclass of Karzanov networks
entry.summary: The path packing problem is stated finding the maximum number of edge-disjoint paths between predefined pairs of nodes in an undirected multigraph. Such a multigraph together with predefined node pairs is often called a network.
entry.arxiv:comment: While correct, this was deemed uninteresting by a journal

entry.title: The median of the distance between two leaves in a phylogenetic tree
entry.summary: We establish a limit formula for the median of the distance between two leaves in a fully resolved unrooted phylogenetic tree with n leaves. More precisely, we prove that this median is equal, in the limit, to the square root of 4*ln(2)*n.

entry.title: Generating and ranking of Dyck words
entry.summary: A new algorithm to generate all Dyck words is presented, which is used in ranking and unranking Dyck words. We emphasize the importance of using Dyck words in encoding objects related to Catalan numbers. As a consequence of formulas used in the ranking algorithm we can obtain a recursive formula for the nth Catalan number.

entry.title: On the d-complexity of strings
entry.summary: This paper deals with the complexity of strings, which play an important role in biology (nucleotid sequences), information theory and computer science. The d-complexity of a string is defined as the number of its distinct d-substrings given in Definition 1. The case d=1 is studied in detail.

entry.title: On k-hypertournament losing scores
entry.summary: We give a new and short proof of a theorem on k-hypertournament losing scores due to Zhou et al. [G. Zhou, T. Yao, K. Zhang, On score sequences of k-tournaments, European J. Comb., 21, 8 (2000) 993-1000.]

entry.title: A Computational Approach to the Graceful Tree Conjecture
entry.summary: Graceful tree conjecture is a well-known open problem in graph theory. Here we present a computational approach to this conjecture. An algorithm for finding graceful labelling for trees is proposed. With this algorithm, we show that every tree with at most 35 vertices allows a graceful labelling, hence we verify that the graceful tree conjecture is correct for trees with at most 35 vertices.

entry.title: Enumeration of Hamiltonian Cycles in 6-cube
entry.summary: Finding the number 2H6 of directed Hamiltonian cycles in 6-cube is problem 43 in Section 7.2.1.1 of Knuth's ' The Art of Computer Programming'; various proposed estimates are surveyed below. We computed exact value: H6=14,754,666,508,334,433,250,560=6*2^4*217,199*1,085,989*5,429,923. Also the number Aut6 of those cycles up to automorphisms of 6-cube was computed as 147,365,405,634,413,085

entry.title: Optimal (v, 4, 2, 1) optical orthogonal codes with small parameters
entry.summary: Optimal (v, 4, 2, 1) optical orthogonal codes (OOC) with $v<=75$ and $v\ne 71$ are classified up to equivalence. One $(v, 4, 2, 1)$ OOC is presented for all $v\le 181$, for which an optimal OOC exists.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by authors

entry.title: A CF-Based Randomness Measure for Sequences
entry.summary: This note examines the question of randomness in a sequence based on the continued fraction (CF) representation of its corresponding representation as a number, or as D sequence. We propose a randomness measure that is directly equal to the number of components of the CF representation. This provides a means of quantifying the randomness of the popular PN sequences as well. A comparison is made of representation as a fraction and as a continued fraction.

entry.title: Graph Triangulations and the Compatibility of Unrooted Phylogenetic Trees
entry.summary: We characterize the compatibility of a collection of unrooted phylogenetic trees as a question of determining whether a graph derived from these trees --- the display graph --- has a specific kind of triangulation, which we call legal. Our result is a counterpart to the well known triangulation-based characterization of the compatibility of undirected multi-state characters.

entry.title: Average case performance of heuristics for multi-dimensional assignment problems
entry.summary: We consider multi-dimensional assignment problems in a probabilistic setting. Our main results are: (i) A new efficient algorithm for the 3-dimensional planar problem, based on enumerating and selecting from a set of "alternating-path trees"; (ii) A new efficient matching-based algorithm for the 3-dimensional axial problem.

entry.title: Determining Edge Expansion and Other Connectivity Measures of Graphs of Bounded Genus
entry.summary: In this paper, we show that for an $n$-vertex graph $G$ of genus $g$, the edge expansion of $G$ can be determined in time $n^{O(g^2)}$. We show that the same is true for various other similar measures of edge connectivity.

entry.title: Watching Systems in graphs: an extension of Identifying Codes
entry.summary: We introduce the notion of watching systems in graphs, which is a generalization of that of identifying codes. We give some basic properties of watching systems, an upper bound on the minimum size of a watching system, and results on the graphs which achieve this bound; we also study the cases of the paths and cycles, and give complexity results.

entry.title: A note on concentration of submodular functions
entry.summary: We survey a few concentration inequalities for submodular and fractionally subadditive functions of independent random variables, implied by the entropy method for self-bounding functions. The power of these concentration bounds is that they are dimension-free, in particular implying standard deviation O(\sqrt{\E[f]}) rather than O(\sqrt{n}) which can be obtained for any 1-Lipschitz function of n variables.

entry.title: Integrality Gap of the Hypergraphic Relaxation of Steiner Trees: a short proof of a 1.55 upper bound
entry.summary: Recently Byrka, Grandoni, Rothvoss and Sanita (at STOC 2010) gave a 1.39-approximation for the Steiner tree problem, using a hypergraph-based linear programming relaxation. They also upper-bounded its integrality gap by 1.55. We describe a shorter proof of the same integrality gap bound, by applying some of their techniques to a randomized loss-contracting algorithm.

entry.title: Monotonic Mappings Invariant Linearisation of Finite Posets
entry.summary: In this paper we describe a novel a procedure to build a linear order from an arbitrary poset which (i) preserves the original ordering and (ii) allows to extend monotonic and antitonic mappings defined over the original poset to monotonic and antitonic mappings over the new linear poset.

entry.title: Parallel Chip Firing Game associated with n-cube orientations
entry.summary: We study the cycles generated by the chip firing game associated with n-cube orientations. We show the existence of the cycles generated by parallel evolutions of even lengths from 2 to $2^n$ on $H_n$ (n >= 1), and of odd lengths different from 3 and ranging from 1 to $2^{n-1}-1$ on $H_n$ (n >= 4).
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: International Conference on Computational Science 2004, ICCS 2004, Krakov : Poland (2004)

entry.title: Min st-Cut of a Planar Graph in O(n loglog n) Time
entry.summary: Given a planar undirected n-vertex graph G with non-negative edge weights, we show how to compute, for given vertices s and t in G, a min st-cut in G in O(n loglog n) time and O(n) space. The previous best time bound was O(n log n).
entry.arxiv:comment: Added mainly details and corrections to the r-division section

entry.title: Coloring translates and homothets of a convex body
entry.summary: We obtain improved upper bounds and new lower bounds on the chromatic number as a linear function of the clique number, for the intersection graphs (and their complements) of finite families of translates and homothets of a convex body in $\RR^n$.

entry.title: On disjoint paths in acyclic planar graphs
entry.summary: We give an algorithm with complexity $O(f(R)^{k^2} k^3 n)$ for the integer multiflow problem on instances $(G,H,r,c)$ with $G$ an acyclic planar digraph and $r+c$ Eulerian. Here, $f$ is a polynomial function, $n = |V(G)|$, $k = |E(H)|$ and $R$ is the maximum request $\max_{h \in E(H)} r(h)$. When $k$ is fixed, this gives a polynomial algorithm for the arc-disjoint paths problem under the same hypothesis.

entry.title: Congestion in planar graphs with demands on faces
entry.summary: We give an algorithm to route a multicommodity flow in a planar graph $G$ with congestion $O(\log k)$, where $k$ is the maximum number of terminals on the boundary of a face, when each demand edge lie on a face of $G$. We also show that our specific method cannot achieve a substantially better congestion.

entry.title: Second Moment Method on k-SAT: a General Framework
entry.summary: We give a general framework implementing the Second Moment Method on k-SAT and discuss the conditions making the Second Moment Method work in this framework. As applications, we make the Second Moment Method work on boolean solutions and implicants. We extend this to the distributional model of k-SAT.

entry.title: Shortened Hamming Codes Maximizing Double Error Detection
entry.summary: Given $r\geq 3$ and $2^{r-1}+1\leq n< 2^{r}-1$, an $[n,n-r,3]$ shortened Hamming code that can detect a maximal number of double errors is constructed. The optimality of the construction is proven.
entry.arxiv:comment: We withdraw the paper since we found a reference from 1981 that solves exactly the same problem

entry.title: Dynamics in parallel of double Boolean automata circuits
entry.summary: In this paper, we give some results concerning the dynamics of double Boolean automata circuits (dbac's for short), namely, networks associated to interaction graphs composed of two side-circuits that share a node. More precisely, we give formulas for the number of attractors of any period, as well as the total number of attractors of these networks.

entry.title: Wheel Random Apollonian Graphs
entry.summary: In this paper a subset of High-Dimensional Random Apollonian networks, that we called Wheel Random Apollonian Graphs (WRAG), is considered. We show how to generate a Wheel Random Apollonian Graph from a wheel graph. We analyse some basic graph properties like vertices and edges cardinality, some question concerning cycles and the chromaticity in such type of graphs, we suggest further work on this type of graphs.

entry.title: On z-factorization and c-factorization of standard episturmian words
entry.summary: Ziv-Lempel and Crochemore factorization are two kinds of factorizations of words related to text processing. In this paper, we find these factorizations for standard epiesturmian words. Thus the previously known c-factorization of standard Sturmian words is provided as a special case. Moreover, the two factorizations are compared.

entry.title: Some fascinating series and their sums
entry.summary: In this paper we present some interesting results involving summation of series in particular trigonometric ones. We failed to locate these results in existing literature or in the web like MathWorld (http://mathworld.wolfram.com/) nor could we derive them using software for analytical computation like Maple. The identities are beautiful and involve finite series.

entry.title: Middle and Ripple, fast simple O(lg n) algorithms for Lucas Numbers
entry.summary: A fast simple O(\log n) iteration algorithm for individual Lucas numbers is given. This is faster than using Fibonacci based methods because of the structure of Lucas numbers. Using a sqrt 5 conversion factor on Lucus numbers gives a faster Fibonacci algorithm. In addition, a fast simple recursive algorithm for individual Lucas numbers is given that is O(log n).

entry.title: Yet another aperiodic tile set
